sentence.Network_en: We think an attempt to bully them into submission would be counterproductive.

sentence.Network_cn: 必须准备一份书面报告。

sentence.Network_en: Their approach simply bludgeons you into submission.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的方法就是迫使你屈服。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin submissio(n-), from the verb submittere (see submit)

entry.def: Submission is a state in which people can no longer do what they want to do because they have been brought under the control of someone else.

example.ex: The army intends to take the city or simply starve it into submission.
example.tran: 军队打算占领该城市或干脆截断其粮食补给迫使其投降。

entry.def: The submission of a proposal, report, or other document is the act of formally sending it to someone, so that they can consider it or decide about it.

example.ex: Diploma and certificate courses do not normally require the submission of a dissertation.
example.tran: 为获得文凭和证书所修的课程通常不需要提交论文。

entry.tran: 提交的建议(或报告等);呈递的文件
entry.def: A submission is a proposal, report, or other document that is formally sent or presented to someone, so that they can consider or decide about it.

example.ex: A written submission has to be prepared.
example.tran: 必须准备一份书面报告。

means.word_mean: 1. something (manuscripts or architectural plans and models or estimates or works of art of all genres etc.) submitted for the judgment of others (as in a competition);

sentences.sentence: "several of his submissions were rejected by publishers"
"what was the date of submission of your proposal?"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of submitting; usually surrendering power to another
3. the condition of having submitted to control by someone or something else;

sentences.sentence: "his submission to the will of God"

means.word_mean: 4. the feeling of patient submissive humbleness
5. a legal document summarizing an agreement between parties in a dispute to abide by the decision of an arbiter
6. an agreement between parties in a dispute to abide by the decision of an arbiter
7. (law) a contention presented by a lawyer to a judge or jury as part of the case he is arguing

stems_affixes.word_buile: miss[v.错过;想念]+ing表形容词→adj.不见的, 缺少的
re不+miss送,放出,派,错过→不送出去→怠慢的
per始终+miss送,放出,派,错过+ive……的→始终放出→纵容的
sub在下面+miss放+ive表形容词→放下面→恭顺的
mission[n.使命,任务;使团,代表团]+ary人→n.传教士

e出+miss送,放出+ion表名词→送出去
re再+miss送,放出+ion表名词→再次放过[别人]→宽恕
o出+miss送,放出+ion表名词→放出去→省略
per始终+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→始终放出→允许
trans横+miss送,放出+ion表名词→横着送出去→播送
e出+miss送,放出+ary人→送出去的人
sub下面+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→放下面→屈服

sentences.en: Her present submission is animated solely by her fear of punishment.
sentences.cn: 她目前的屈从完全是因为她害怕受罚。

sentences.en: I demand the submission of the signature to an expert.
sentences.cn: 我要求把这签名提交专家鉴定。
